name: Classic Litti Chokha
description: Our signature dish - roasted wheat balls with sattu filling
longDescription: The crown jewel of Bihari cuisine. Our Litti is made from whole wheat dough stuffed with roasted gram flour (sattu) mixed with aromatic spices, garlic, and herbs. Slow-roasted over traditional coal fire until perfectly charred and served with smoky baingan bharta, tomato chokha, and pure desi ghee.

name: Sattu Paratha
description: Crispy flatbread stuffed with spiced roasted gram flour
longDescription: A breakfast favorite from the streets of Patna. Flaky, layered paratha stuffed generously with roasted sattu mixed with green chilies, onions, and secret spices. Pan-fried in ghee to golden perfection. Served with pickle and curd.

name: Bihari Mutton Curry
description: Slow-cooked mutton in rich, aromatic gravy
longDescription: Tender pieces of mutton slow-cooked for hours in a rich gravy made with caramelized onions, ginger, garlic, and a secret blend of Bihari spices. The meat falls off the bone, infused with deep, complex flavors that define our culinary heritage.

name: Kadhi Bari
description: Gram flour dumplings in tangy yogurt curry
longDescription: A comforting bowl of Bihari Kadhi featuring soft pakodas (baris) made from gram flour, swimming in a silky, tangy yogurt-based gravy tempered with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and dried red chilies. Best enjoyed with steamed rice.

name: Maacher Jhol
longDescription: Fresh river fish cooked in a light, aromatic curry with tomatoes, turmeric, and green chilies. A testament to the riverine culture of Bihar. The fish is first marinated in turmeric and salt, lightly fried, then simmered in the curry until it absorbs all the flavors.

name: Chana Ghugni
description: Spiced chickpea curry, a popular street food
longDescription: A beloved street food from Bihar and Bengal. White chickpeas cooked with potatoes in a spicy, tangy gravy with cumin, coriander, and a touch of tamarind. Topped with fresh onions, green chilies, and a squeeze of lime. Perfect as a snack or side dish.

name: Thekua
longDescription: A festive favorite, especially during Chhath Puja. These crispy, sweet cookies are made from whole wheat flour, jaggery, and ghee, flavored with fennel seeds and cardamom. Fried until golden and aromatic. A perfect ending to your Bihari meal.

name: Chicken Boti Kebab
description: Tender marinated chicken pieces grilled to perfection
longDescription: Succulent pieces of chicken thigh marinated overnight in a blend of yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and aromatic spices including mustard oil and roasted chana powder. Grilled in tandoor until charred on the outside and juicy inside. Served with mint chutney.

name: Aloo Bhujia
longDescription: Thinly sliced potatoes stir-fried with mustard oil, nigella seeds (kalonji), and green chilies until crispy on the edges. A simple yet addictive side dish that showcases the beauty of Bihari cooking - minimal ingredients, maximum flavor.

name: Sattu Sharbat
longDescription: The original protein shake! Roasted sattu mixed with cold water, lemon juice, roasted cumin, black salt, and a hint of jaggery. Incredibly refreshing and energizing - the perfect summer cooler that has fueled generations of Biharis.

name: Dal Pitha
description: Steamed rice dumplings with lentil filling
longDescription: Delicate steamed dumplings made from rice flour, filled with a savory mixture of chana dal, ginger, and spices. Served with ghee and a side of tangy tomato chutney. A healthier alternative that doesn't compromise on taste.

name: Makhana Kheer
longDescription: Roasted makhana (fox nuts) simmered in reduced milk with cardamom, saffron, and rose water. Garnished with slivered almonds and pistachios. A luxurious dessert that celebrates Bihar's famous makhana harvest. Rich, creamy, and utterly indulgent.
